trans:
(Is it Asperox Yellow Power, right, MeryoğŸ˜¶)
"What are these bags, Mom?"
"I havenâ€™t made bÃ¶rek for my black lamb in a long time. I thought we could make a tray of bÃ¶rek together, and youâ€™ll learn how to do it. After all, if you haven't learned by now while being with me..."
Zeynep laughed.
"I already know how to make it!"
"Look at you! Letâ€™s see those skillful hands, Zeynep!"
Zeynep smiled and began taking the ingredients out of the bag. She left some of them in the bag and handed them to her mother.
"You can take these back; we have them at home."
"Keep them in reserve."
"No, Mom, I'll ask you for them when I need them. Keep them with you."
"Alright, if you say so."
Zeynep took out the necessary ingredients. She mixed, kneaded, and rolled the dough. She spread the layers of filo dough on the tray, brushing butter between each layer. When she reached halfway, she added the cheesy filling. She covered it with more layers of dough, repeating the same steps. Then, she brushed the top with butter and put the tray in the oven. While it baked, they started tidying up the surroundings.
"Well done, my black lamb, at this rate youâ€™ll pass me!"
"It'll be hard to pass you, Mom, you make the best bÃ¶rek. Iâ€™ll just get close."
"My black lamb is so modest!"
Zeynep giggled as her mother hugged and kissed her. Then, they sat down together and had a few cups of tea. Meryem, glancing at the clock, asked curiously:
"Isnâ€™t MÃ¼rÅŸid Hazretleri coming?"
